intro: Cissus hispida, commonly known as the velvety wood sorrel, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It features heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it a soft, textured appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers followed by edible, sour-tasting berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Cissus hispida is often used in ornamental horticulture for its attractive foliage and easy care requirements.
